keyMoments.title: Luffy vs. Entranced Zoro
keyMoments.description: Luffy makes the difficult decision to fight his own crewmate Zoro, who is under Noko's hypnotic control, to prevent him from harming the rest of the crew.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's leadership and willingness to make hard choices to protect his nakama, even if it means fighting one of them.
keyMoments.quote: You guys go on ahead! I'll handle Zoro!

keyMoments.title: Orders Crew to Continue
keyMoments.description: Luffy orders the rest of the crew to continue toward the Palace of the Sea God while he stays behind to deal with Zoro.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's tactical thinking and his trust that his crew can handle their mission without him.

keyMoments.title: Entranced Zoro Appears
keyMoments.description: Zoro emerges from the forest under Noko's hypnotic control, threatening his own crewmates with his swords.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the extent of Noko's dangerous hypnotic powers and creates dramatic tension as Luffy must fight his own first mate.

keyMoments.title: Oni Giri Under Hypnosis
keyMoments.description: While hypnotized, Zoro uses his powerful Oni Giri technique against Luffy, demonstrating his full combat abilities even without conscious control.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals that hypnotized individuals retain their fighting skills, making them extremely dangerous opponents.

keyMoments.title: Zoro's Memory Recovery
keyMoments.description: Zoro breaks free from Noko's hypnotic control and regains his memories, rejoining the crew with information about Luffy's location.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the beginning of the crew's victory over Noko as they start recovering their stolen memories and freed comrades.

keyMoments.title: Decisive Kick Against Noko
keyMoments.description: Sanji delivers a powerful kick to Noko the seahorse, breaking the creature's hypnotic control over the crew while they coordinate by closing their eyes.
keyMoments.significance: Sanji's combat skills prove crucial to defeating Noko. Demonstrates the crew's teamwork in coordinating to avoid eye contact while enabling Sanji's attack.

keyMoments.title: Defensive Attack on Zoro
keyMoments.description: When Zoro emerges from the forest, Sanji immediately attacks him defensively, uncertain whether the swordsman is still under hypnotic control.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Sanji's protective instincts and quick reflexes, prioritizing crew safety even if it means attacking a crewmate.

keyMoments.title: Leading the Crew
keyMoments.description: Robin leads the Straw Hats through the forest toward the Palace of the Sea God, being the only crew member who retained her memories.
keyMoments.significance: Robin's immunity to Noko's initial memory theft makes her the crucial guide for the crew's mission.

keyMoments.title: Identifying Noko as Culprit
keyMoments.description: Robin helps the crew realize that Noko the seahorse, not Drim, has been stealing their memories all along.
keyMoments.significance: Robin's analytical abilities help solve the mystery of the memory theft.

keyMoments.title: Revealed as True Memory Thief
keyMoments.description: Noko is exposed as the true culprit behind the memory theft, having manipulated Drim through hypnosis to assist in the scheme.
keyMoments.significance: Major plot revelation that shifts the focus from Drim to Noko as the arc's primary antagonist.

keyMoments.title: Hypnotic Eye Technique
keyMoments.description: Noko demonstrates his ability to hypnotize people by locking eyes with them, forcing the crew to avoid direct eye contact.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the mechanics of Noko's powers and the strategy needed to defeat him.

keyMoments.title: Battle at the Lakeside
keyMoments.description: Noko engages the Straw Hats in battle at the lakeside location, using his hypnotic powers and Devil Fruit abilities against them.
keyMoments.significance: Climactic confrontation where the crew must defeat Noko to recover their memories.

abilities.description: By being played as an instrument, Noko emits a low, mournful sound that steals memories from sleeping listeners.
Noko can lock eyes with targets to control their actions through hypnosis. His eyes glow red when using this power.

relationships.description: Noko hypnotized Drim and forced the young boy to assist in stealing memories from the Straw Hats and island residents.

evolutionMoments.description: It is revealed that Drim was under Noko's control all along and was not acting of his own free will.

reveals.information: Noko is the true culprit behind the memory theft, not Drim
Can hypnotize people through direct eye contact

keyMoments.title: Apprehended by the Crew
keyMoments.description: The Straw Hats catch Drim, believing him to be responsible for stealing their memories, and confront him about his actions.
keyMoments.significance: Represents a turning point where the crew gets closer to understanding the truth about the memory theft.

keyMoments.title: Revealed as Noko's Victim
keyMoments.description: The crew discovers that Drim was not acting of his own volition but was being controlled by Noko's hypnotic powers.
keyMoments.significance: Recontextualizes Drim as a victim rather than a villain, showing the extent of Noko's manipulation.

relationships.description: Drim was hypnotized and controlled by Noko, forced to assist in the memory theft scheme against his will.

evolutionMoments.description: The full extent of Noko's control over Drim is revealed to the Straw Hats.

reveals.information: Drim was a victim of Noko's hypnosis, not the true villain
